previous: This might be interpreted as: with probability 0.95 we will find a confidence interval in which the value of parameter Î¼ will be between the stochastic endpoints
after: This does not mean there is 0.95 probability that the value of parameter Î¼ is in the interval obtained by using the currently computed value of the sample mean,

Instead, every time the measurements are repeated, there will be another value for the meanÂ X of the sample. In 95% of the cases Î¼ will be between the endpoints calculated from this mean, but in 5% of the cases it will not be.
